result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant DAVID J SCOTT in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for DAVID J SCOTT.  Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Received offer. 
Attorney Thorson pursuing collateral attack with South Dakota OWI. 
Preliminary hearing to be scheduled with the JA. 
Complete booking process. 
Bond continued.

11:23 AM Defendant DAVID J SCOTT in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for DAVID J SCOTT.  Attorney Sara Matthews in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF351. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
Complete booking process. 
Bonds continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BOND COVERS 22CF351, 22CF75, & 22CM81
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.
Not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Daily PBTs at CHSO; or enroll and actively participate in IDIP; or Soberlink device.
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring
conditions.
No contact with victims
Review hearing on August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
